title.narrative: Indigenous rights and culture in Adivasi forest communities

description.narrative: As ca. 50 % of the people displaced by development projects in India are indigenous Adivasis who are less than 10 % of its population India's development violates the equality of their human rights. Particularly Vulnerable Tribal Groups (PVTGs) are most di splaced + violated Adivasis whose life subsistence nutrition + life-heritage get endangered by takeover of their lands. Child underweight + malnutrition are higher in project's PVTG areas in Central India than in most African LDC areas.Our project works to protect PVTG forest communities' human rights + habitats. It builds PVTG forums workshops + trainings for their unity + awareness on their rights including those under the Forest Rights Act (FRA). PVTGs' capacity to protect their forests for their sustain able use has to be built to secure their forest + community rights as legally registered for their livelihoods - equally also for women.-Project trains + supports PVTGs - particularly the women as carriers of PVTG forest life-heritage - to get their rights to food water health education shelter + livelihood duly secured to address PVTG-population decline remote habitation + below 5% literacy among 25 year old adults -Women get trained + aware also on gender rights (reproductive rights rights against violenc e + witchcraft charges etc.) and to secure their income Minor Forest Produce value addition + equal access to property governance + information in decisions that affect them -We improve PVTG food security by reviving climate change resistant indigenous cul tivation + trees - increasing their productivity by land development + reviving water bodies on forest tenures they have secured under the FRA -PVTGs claim protect manage + sustain their biodiverse habitats + community forests making state to register + re spect these. Project builds also world's awareness on PVTGs' sustainable forest-life by wider communication campaign-PVTGs + Persons With Disability girls particularly get secured their education jobs livelihood + provisions entitled for them - as now thei r school enrollment jobs+ skills support is low in PVTG areas with teachers + health services not equally present
